intro: Eriachne malouinensis, commonly known as the Malouin's grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often found in coastal or arid environments. The plant has slender, erect stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the grass family. Eriachne malouinensis is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
